analyzed: @80b dang por re zhig sngags pas stan bde ba la nye bar 'dug ste /
translated: First, the mantrin should sit on a comfortable seat

original: rang gi snying gar pam yig yongs su gyur pa las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar pam yig yongs su gyur pa las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa /
translated: and visualize an eight-petaled lotus arisen from the transformation of the syllable paṃ in his heart center.

original: de'i steng du aa yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de'i steng du aa yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: Upon that, an arisen moon maṇḍala from the transformation of the syllable a.

original: de'i steng du hr'i:yig las 'od zer bltas te /
analyzed: de'i steng du hr'i:yig las 'od zer bltas te /
translated: Upon that, light rays shine from the syllable hrīḥ.

original: 'od zer des 'og min gyi sa la zhugs te ;
analyzed: 'od zer des 'og min gyi sa la zhugs te ;
translated: Those light rays enter the ground of Akaniṣṭha,

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug gdan drangs nas mdun gyi nam mkha'i mthil du bltas te sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug gdan drangs nas mdun gyi nam mkha'i mthil du bltas te sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: invite Lokeśvara, and he should be seen in the sky in front. Confession of misdeeds and so forth should be done.

original: 'di lta ste sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bdag nyid dbul ba dang ; gsol ba 'debs pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed par byas nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bdag nyid dbul ba dang ; gsol ba 'debs pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed par byas nas /
translated: In this way, having confessed one's sins, rejoiced in the merits, transferred one's merits, gone for refuge to the Three Jewels, offered oneself, made requests, and generated the spirit of enlightenment,

original: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya ste /
translated: one should cultivate the four divine abodes.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: They are loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de nas stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then one should cultivate emptiness.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes pas rang gi lus gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bar bltas la /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes pas rang gi lus gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bar bltas la /
translated: With the mantra, Om, I am the emptiness of the knowledge of the vajra nature, one should view one's body as a reflection.

original: snying ga'i dbus su pam yig las skyes pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa /
analyzed: snying ga'i dbus su pam yig las skyes pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa /
translated: In the center of one's heart, from the syllable Pam, one should visualize an eight-petaled lotus.

original: de'i steng du aa yig las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i steng du hr'i:yig dmar po'i 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bkug cing bcug nas bdag nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs su bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du aa yig las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i steng du hr'i:yig dmar po'i 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bkug cing bcug nas bdag nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs su bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should visualize oneself in the form of Lokesvara.

original: sku mdog dkar po ral pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: sku mdog dkar po ral pa'i cod pan can /
translated: White in color, with a crown of hair.

original: phyag g-yas pa mchog sbyin /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa mchog sbyin /
translated: The right hand is in the boon-granting gesture.

original: cig shos na padma dkar po bsnams pa /
analyzed: cig shos na padma dkar po bsnams pa /
translated: The left holds a white lotus.

original: skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs shing rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs shing rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: Seated in the half-cross-legged posture, adorned with all the ornaments.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i cod pan can /
translated: With an Amitabha crown.

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa /
translated: Endowed with the thirty-two major marks.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus spras pa /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus spras pa /
translated: Adorned with the eighty minor marks.

original: zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od lta bu'i bdag nyid rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od lta bu'i bdag nyid rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize oneself as having the nature of moon light, seated upon a moon seat.

original: de'i g-yas su 'phags ma sgrol ma dang nor bzangs /
analyzed: de'i g-yas su 'phags ma sgrol ma dang nor bzangs /
translated: To the right of that, one should visualize Tara and Manis.

original: g-yon du khro gnyer can dang rta mgrin /
analyzed: g-yon du khro gnyer can dang rta mgrin /
translated: To the left, one should visualize Bhrkuti and Hayagriva.

original: shar du rnam par snang mdzad /
analyzed: shar du rnam par snang mdzad /
translated: In the east, one should visualize Vairocana.

original: lhor rin chen 'byung ldan /
analyzed: lhor rin chen 'byung ldan /
translated: In the south, Ratnasaṃbhava;

original: nub tu 'od dpag med /
analyzed: nub tu 'od dpag med /
translated: in the west, Amitābha;🔽and in the north, Amoghasiddhi.

original: byang du don yod grub pa rnams so //🔽mer spyan ma /
analyzed: byang du don yod grub pa rnams so // mer spyan ma /
translated: In the southeast, Locanā;

original: bden bral du m'a ma k'i /🔽rlung du gos dkar mo //
analyzed: bden bral du m'a ma k'i / rlung du gos dkar mo //
translated: in the southwest, Māmakī;🔽in the northwest, Pāṇḍaravāsinī;

original: dbang ldan du rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma rnams so //
analyzed: dbang ldan du rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma rnams so //
translated: and in the northeast, Vajradhātvīśvarī.

original: de nas snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes sems dpa' dgug cing rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes sems dpa' dgug cing rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, with light rays from the seed syllable in the heart, one should summon and induct the awareness beings.

original: mig la sogs pa byin gyis @81a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa byin gyis @81a * //
translated: One should bless the eyes and so forth,

original: brlabs shing / lus dang ngag dang yid byin gyis brlabs nas dbang bskur ba zhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: brlabs shing / lus dang ngag dang yid byin gyis brlabs nas dbang bskur ba zhu bar bya'o //
translated: bless the body, speech, and mind, and request the empowerment.

original: ji ltar 'khrungs tsam nyid nas ni //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrungs tsam nyid nas ni //
translated: Just as soon as they were born,

original: de bzhin gshegs rnams khrus gsol ba //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs rnams khrus gsol ba //
translated: the tathāgatas were offered a bath

original: lha yi chu bo dag pa yis //
analyzed: lha yi chu bo dag pa yis //
translated: with the pure divine waters

original: de bzhin bdag kyang khrus mdzad gsol //
analyzed: de bzhin bdag kyang khrus mdzad gsol //
translated: and likewise I request a bath.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she ka ta sa ma ya shri ye h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she ka ta sa ma ya shri ye h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata abhiṣekata samaya śrīye hūṃ phaṭ svāhā

original: spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo bcu yang dag par spros nas mchod pa dang bstod pa byas te /
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo bcu yang dag par spros nas mchod pa dang bstod pa byas te /
translated: Having emanated the ten goddesses such as Locanā, one should make offerings and praise.

original: sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra.

original: de la sngags ni 'di'o //
analyzed: de la sngags ni 'di'o //
translated: The mantra is this:

original: aom hr'i:sv'a h'a zhes so //
analyzed: aom hr'i:sv'a h'a zhes so //
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ svāhā.

original: dpal ldan mkha' spyod kyi sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: dpal ldan mkha' spyod kyi sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of glorious Khecarī is complete.
